comments:
If I try and launch a runtime workbench using the latest code (core + ui) from
HEAD (as of ~10:30AM on Tuesday, Sept 16th) on Sun 1.4.1 without clearing the
workspace before launch the eclipse splash screen will occasionally stay up
forever and the runtime workbench never launches.  Once this happens for the
first time it will happen consistantly until I clear the workspace prior to
launch.  If I try on J9 sidecar I get the same behaviour but I also get a
message to System.err that reads:

java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at java.lang.Throwable.fillInStackTrace(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:106)
	at java.lang.Exception.<init>(Exception.java:53)
	at java.lang.ClassNotFoundException.<init>(ClassNotFoundException.java:80)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:243)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:521)
	at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:441)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:587)

When this occurs the runtime workspace no longer has a .registry file in the
.metadata directory.

I have seen the same problem. Kim thinks it may have to do with having 
preferences set.
This is a problem we've introduced in our experimental Role.
